intro: Ionactis linariifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf ionactis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves that give it its common name. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Ionactis linariifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
